persons.name: Tiberius Claudius Atticus
persons.role: High Priest of the Augusti, Treasurer, and Benefactor

rationale: This Athenian decree, dated to approximately 120 AD during the reign of Hadrian, honors Tiberius Claudius Atticus of Marathon and his wife Vibullia Alcia. It recognizes Atticus's service as High Priest of the Imperial Cult and Treasurer, specifically noting his performance of sacrifices for the Emperor's well-being and his generous gymnasiarchy. The Council resolved to crown them with golden crowns and erect bronze statues in their honor, with the decree itself to be displayed on a stone stele.
